Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • Rule
  • public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
    representation of a Rule object that contains a ruleNum and methods to evolve a Generation object to the next state
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Katherine Carbonell

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Rule​(int ruleNumP)
      Rule constructor, creates a new Rule object and checks to make sure ruleNum given is within the bounds [0, 255] if outside bounds, ruleNum becomes closest valid number

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String arrayToString​(int[] array)
      helper method, converts an array of ints to a String containing the array's values
      java.lang.String booleanToString​(boolean bool)
      helper method to convert boolean values to 0 or 1 (as Strings)
      boolean charToBoolean​(char character)
      helper method, intended to convert a char value of 0 or 1 into boolean, with 0 being false and 1 being true
      boolean evolve​(boolean[] neighborhood)
      given the neighborhood of a cell, evolve that cell to the next state
      Generation evolve​(Generation gen)
      evolves an entire generation object to the next state
      static boolean[] getNeighborhood​(int idx, Generation gen)
      finds the neighborhood of a specified index in a specified generation in the format {left-neighbor, index, right-neighbor}
      int getRuleNum()
      ruleNum accessor
      java.lang.String intToBinary1​(int value)
      helper method, changes given int value into a binary string of length 3 (padded on left side with 0s if length is less than 3, (intended to be used on number 0-7 only)
      java.lang.String intToBinary2​(int value)
      helper method, changes given int value into a binary string of length 8 (padded on left side with 0s if length is less than 8, (intended to be used on number greater than 7)
      java.lang.String neighborhoodToBinary​(boolean[] neighborhood)
      helper method, changes boolean neighborhood array into 1s and 0s using false = 0; true = 1

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rule

        public Rule​(int ruleNumP)
        Rule constructor, creates a new Rule object and checks to make sure ruleNum given is within the bounds [0, 255] if outside bounds, ruleNum becomes closest valid number
        Parameters:
        ruleNumP - value user wants to set ruleNum to

    • Method Detail

      • getRuleNum

        public int getRuleNum()
        ruleNum accessor
        Returns:
        returns ruleNum associated with Rule object the method was called on

      • getNeighborhood

        public static boolean[] getNeighborhood​(int idx,
                                        Generation gen)
        finds the neighborhood of a specified index in a specified generation in the format {left-neighbor, index, right-neighbor}
        Parameters:
        idx - index of cell you want to get the neighborhood of
        gen - generation of cell you want to get the neighborhood of
        Returns:
        returns a boolean array of the cell states of the neighborhood of the cell at the given index

      • evolve

        public boolean evolve​(boolean[] neighborhood)
        given the neighborhood of a cell, evolve that cell to the next state
        Parameters:
        neighborhood - neighborhood you want evolved
        Returns:
        returns the evolved state of the center cell of the neighborhood

      • evolve

        public Generation evolve​(Generation gen)
        evolves an entire generation object to the next state
        Parameters:
        gen - generation object you want evolved
        Returns:
        returns the next step in the Generation's evolution

        helper method, converts an array of ints to a String containing the array's values
        Parameters:
        array - array to be converted to a String
        Returns:
        returns String representation of int array with no spaces or commas between elements

      • intToBinary1

        public java.lang.String intToBinary1​(int value)
        helper method, changes given int value into a binary string of length 3 (padded on left side with 0s if length is less than 3, (intended to be used on number 0-7 only)
        Parameters:
        value - value you want converted to binary
        Returns:
        returns the number as a binary string 3 characters long

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • neighborhoodToBinary

        public java.lang.String neighborhoodToBinary​(boolean[] neighborhood)
        helper method, changes boolean neighborhood array into 1s and 0s using false = 0; true = 1
        Parameters:
        neighborhood - neighborhood you want converted into 1s and 0s
        Returns:
